title: Kirchhoff junction - battery and equal R1 R2 R3 R4

content.question: In the circuit diagram shown in the figure, the four resistors are all identical. Which of the following claims about a current in the circuit is true?

choices.label: The current in Resistor <math alttext="R sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>R</mtext><mn>1</mn></msub></math> is less than half the current in the battery.
The current in Resistor <math alttext="R sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>R</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub></math> is half the current in the battery.

The current in resistors <math alttext="R sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>R</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="R sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>R</mtext><mn>3</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="R sub 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>R</mtext><mn>4</mn></msub></math> are equal to each other.

The current in Resistor <math alttext="R sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>R</mtext><mn>3</mn></msub></math> Resistor <math alttext="R sub 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>R</mtext><mn>4</mn></msub></math> are equal to each other.

content.answer: The current in Resistor <math alttext="R sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>R</mtext><mn>3</mn></msub></math> Resistor <math alttext="R sub 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>R</mtext><mn>4</mn></msub></math> are equal to each other.
